Violation_Type: Failure to meet skilled worker requirements
Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by visa officer
Application_Facts: Applicant's work experience assessed as NOC 1431; promotion occurred after application period; additional documents submitted after decision deadline
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of visa officer's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer assessed application and issued refusal before receipt of additional documents
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness under subsection 75(3)
Procedural_Issue: Whether decision was made before allowing time for additional submissions
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and timing of work experience
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must follow procedural fairness but have discretion under IRPA/IRPR
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of qualifying work experience in Skill Type O/A/B during eligibility period
Outcome: Application dismissed; no breach of procedural fairness found
Harm_Assessment: No harm established due to unchanged outcome
Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet skilled worker class requirements under IRPR subsection 75(2)
Evidence_Handling: Additional documents considered immaterial as they would not change outcome
Evidence_Issues: Timing of document submission relative to decision date
Evidence_Assessment: Promotion after application period not counted; NOC 1431 not eligible
Decision_Rationale: Decision would not have changed even with additional documents; no procedural unfairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Post-decision submissions do not retroactively affect eligibility
